p: Thymol was the major compound identified in the essential oil obtained from fresh and dried leaves. The highest thymol content (62.78 ± 0.63%) and inhibition percentage of the DPPH radical (89.97 ± 0.31%) were obtained from fresh leaves. Thus, L. thymoides can be a natural source of thymol, with levels greater than 50% of the composition of the essential oil.
